title: Design reports using SAM record types
content:
To leverage the Service Management report engine capability to create SAM product compliance reports, SAM provides several record types. With these record types, you can design a SAM report in the Service Management report designer and render the report by federating SAM data from the SAM service through UCMDB Gateway.

The data for certain record types in the SAM data model are federated via the UCMDB Gateway. You need to establish connection with the UCMDB Gateway so that you can create compliance reports based on such data. To do this, configure SAM-related parameters in UD/UCMDB. See the following topics depending on the UD/UCMDB you installed:

  • Containerized UD/UCMDB: Configure these SAM-related parameters in the my-values.yaml file: cmsgateway.deployment.sam.host, cmsgateway.deployment.sam.port, cmsgateway.deployment.sam.context. See Service Management integration parameters.
  • Classic UD/UCMDB: Configure the parameters in the [SAM] section of the config.properties file. See Install UCMDB Gateway on Windows or Install UCMDB Gateway on Linux.

Currently, the following reports are provided out of the box:

  • Current compliance meter
  • Top 5 products at risk
  • Top 5 products overspent
  • Products by software publisher

Notes:

  • To view the reports, the user must have the View permission for these record types: License, License metric, Product, Product compliance, Product version, Product version compliance, Software publisher.
  • When customizing a report for ILMT-managed products, make sure the product vendor is IBM(ILMT). Otherwise, the report generated might be wrong.
  • Currently, we only support designing a SAM report from Service Management. Other features such as editing a form, adding an entity link to reference a SAM record type, developing a notification template, or working with processes aren't supported.

Limitation 

Currently, when using the Reports module in Service Management to create a report based on the SAM record types, you can't drill down to view its details.
